title: Day Parts: Sunday Morning Coffee - Chip Davis
description:
This is an excellent compilation album but one that has been hard for me to find.  Ripped from the CD at 256kbs, mp3 with cover art.  The following review is an accurate description.  This album has an interesting mix of genres and style from classical to new age.  If you are a fan of Chip Davis and Mannheim Steamroller, you'll really enjoy this album.  (Have I gushed enough?)

1  	 Sunday Morning Coffee  	 04:07
2 	Sunday Sonata 	04:01
3 	Tempo di Menuetto [From W.A. Mozart Sonata K. 303] 	04:09
4 	Across the View 	04:43
5 	Romance in D-Flat Major, Opus 42 	04:02
6 	My Secret Lust 	05:53
7 	Lento Con Gran Espressione 	04:06
8 	A Story from the Rain 	06:58
9 	Silver Screen Romance 	02:51
10 	On the Boardwalk 	03:46
11 	Berceuse 	02:48
12 	Coffee with Carla 	04:45
13 	Reminiscences 	02:41
14 	Morning Blend 	05:18

Review
Day Parts: Sunday Morning Coffee is a mellow, laid-back sampler featuring new age pieces like Chip Davis' "Morning Blend" and "Sunday Morning Coffee." Michael Hoppe contributes two songs, "Silver Screen Romance" and "Coffee with Carla," while tracks like Richard Burner's "Story from the Rain" and Doug Smith's "Sunday Sonata" and "Across the View" add to this compilation's quiet charm.
- Authored By Heather Phares
